scenario_text.value: ....eyyy! Heyyy, Takuma! Where aaare yooou?
(Agumon’s...looking for me...)

(...but I can’t exactly respond at a time
like this.)

(Everyone’s so quiet. It’s hard to find the
right words to say here.)

(It’s only natural... I mean, what is there
to say at a time like this?)
Dammit... Why did this have to happen...?!
*sob* Miu...
Miu... Miu...

(Kaito hasn’t cried at all. If anything, that
only makes it worse somehow.)

(But things can’t stay this way. Not if we’re
going to make it through this!)
Um, Kaito...

(It’s no use. He won’t even look at me.
I don’t know what I’m supposed to do.)

Pardon me, human children. I realize this is
a difficult time, but might I speak with you?
Jijimon...

Please, could you guys listen to him? He said
there was something he had to tell us.

On behalf of all the other residents, I wish
to express our deepest gratitude.

And...please accept my most heartfelt apology
for your loss.

Don’t...don’t apologize, Jijimon. It wasn’t
your fault.

None of us blame you, or any of the others
from the amusement park for what happened.

Listen, everyone... I think we need to stay
focused on what lies ahead.

Now, more than ever, we need to make it out
of this place alive—to honor Miu’s sacrifice.

She’s right... I’m torn apart by all of this,
but that’s why we have to fight on.

This inconsolable grief of ours could be just
the weak spot our enemies take advantage of.

A calm assessment of our situation clearly
indicates that we should focus on the future.

Yeah...you’re right. We can’t just sit around
crying our eyes out forever.

It’s just like Aoi says. If Miu was still
with us, I’m sure she’d want us to—
Shut your trap.
Huh?

Don’t go making up Miu’s feelings on your
own, dammit!

Honor Miu’s sacrifice, if Miu was alive...
What the hell do you know about her?!
Hey, Kaito, man, we didn’t mean to—
I’ve heard enough.
Wait, Kaito!
Kaito...
